Kedar Mhaswade wrote:
> Is this advisable? Is there no other way?
> 
> To answer the original question however, theoretically once all the
> public methods are tested to satisfaction, aren't all the protected
> methods tested to same degree of satisfaction?

Yes, I suppose that's true, and if that protected method does something 
simple enough, I wouldn't worry about testing it independently. As soon 
as that protected method does something that makes the public method 
tricky to test, or if it becomes important enough to use on its own, I 
would start adding tests for it.

> Is there an independent
> need to test the protected methods?

I test everything I want to work, public, protected, private, or 
otherwise. You should probably do the same.
